snippet.textDisplay: If alot of people agree that this game is good and that the games made after it are good, then since it's widely agreed, it means that anyone in the minority is said to have bad taste because it seems that so many people can agree on the fact that one thing is better than another so they must have good reasons to admire the game. If you hate it, you don't know how to judge a good game or you're misinformed and have never played said game.

snippet.textDisplay:
See, here, this is an actually creative Zelda 2D game. Ever since the very first every 2D Zelda has felt the same to me. This one I can actually differentiate from the others in my mind. It felt like a breath of fresh air.

(Not saying the 2D Zeldas were bad. Just saying they were samey)

snippet.textDisplay:
Minish Cap was awesome, easily one of the Top 10 best Zeldas.
I enjoyed Spirit Tracks myself but I think I know why.
A.) I'm a sucker for character development, particulary relationships of the romantic or hinted romance type which was over half of Spirit Tracks. They get me every time.
B.) Anything was better than the abomination known as the Temple Of The Ocean King. I didn't hate Phantom Hourglass, but my hate for that one Temple knows no bounds. So Spirit Tracks by comparison was a paradise.
snippet.textOriginal:
Minish Cap was awesome, easily one of the Top 10 best Zeldas.
I enjoyed Spirit Tracks myself but I think I know why.
A.) I'm a sucker for character development, particulary relationships of the romantic or hinted romance type which was over half of Spirit Tracks. They get me every time.
B.) Anything was better than the abomination known as the Temple Of The Ocean King. I didn't hate Phantom Hourglass, but my hate for that one Temple knows no bounds. So Spirit Tracks by comparison was a paradise.

snippet.textDisplay: OH MY GOD, I LOVE YOU SUPRADARKY.....I'M CRYING!
snippet.textOriginal: OH MY GOD, I LOVE YOU SUPRADARKY.....I'M CRYING!

snippet.textDisplay: I thought Phantom Hourglass was terrible, but Spirit Tracks was great fun. Just wish they had implemented the train/boat customization better. As it is, you can only get a handful of parts through just playing the game. It's not very fun. Doesn't help that DS graphics are icky in general.
snippet.textOriginal: I thought Phantom Hourglass was terrible, but Spirit Tracks was great fun. Just wish they had implemented the train/boat customization better. As it is, you can only get a handful of parts through just playing the game. It's not very fun. Doesn't help that DS graphics are icky in general.

snippet.textDisplay: It's an incredibly underrated game imo.  Really sad more people didn't play it.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah, but the thing is.. Hard mode would most certainly only mean more/stronger monsters while you deal less and/or take more damage. That really isn't "upping the difficulty". It's just making it more tedious. Having a zelda game actually be more difficult would mean making areas that were actually challenging, monsters that would be tough to deal with and intense boss fights. So just having a difficulty selection probably wouldn't make it a whole lot better.
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah, but the thing is.. Hard mode would most certainly only mean more/stronger monsters while you deal less and/or take more damage. That really isn't "upping the difficulty". It's just making it more tedious. Having a zelda game actually be more difficult would mean making areas that were actually challenging, monsters that would be tough to deal with and intense boss fights. So just having a difficulty selection probably wouldn't make it a whole lot better.

snippet.textDisplay: I do agree. I absolutely love the Oracle series, and their synergy. Minish Cap was an excellent game, the style, gameplay and soundtrack was brilliant. But as you say it was a bit too easy overall, I never really felt tremendously challenged.
snippet.textOriginal: I do agree. I absolutely love the Oracle series, and their synergy. Minish Cap was an excellent game, the style, gameplay and soundtrack was brilliant. But as you say it was a bit too easy overall, I never really felt tremendously challenged.

snippet.textDisplay: The games have been getting a little too easy. It would be nice if a hard mode was offered, while keeping the original difficulty as well. That way, those of us seeking more of a challenge can get it while more casual players can still beat it.

snippet.textDisplay: It's now been 8 years since I last loved an original portable Zelda game. It's a shame really, especially since Link's Awakening is my favorite in the series with OoT. Minish Cap was very good, I was surprised with how nicely Capcom handled this series (MC and both Oracle games). It was too easy though, but that's a problem that's been following this series for quite a while.
snippet.textOriginal: It's now been 8 years since I last loved an original portable Zelda game. It's a shame really, especially since Link's Awakening is my favorite in the series with OoT. Minish Cap was very good, I was surprised with how nicely Capcom handled this series (MC and both Oracle games). It was too easy though, but that's a problem that's been following this series for quite a while.
